name: Crewe Hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our weekend through travelzoo, the deal was great value. We had two night's b&b, plus a 3 course evening meal on the sat night. We also had a free bottle of wine in our room, for £95.00 each. The service was excellent, nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The brassiere and bar staff were mainly young people, we were impressed by the way they were all so smartly dressed and friendly. The food was great, the evening meal was the highlight for us. After our meal we went along to reception to see if we could change our ' free ' bottle of wine from red to white. Not only did they change the wine but a waiter put it in a bucket of ice for us and put it into the lounge area for us to enjoy, we felt really spolit.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Stayed with children as part of chester zoo package.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely loved it...we loved it, kids thoroughly enjoyed it. Leisure facilities are great. Staff helpful. Really clean, value for money. A really nice break. Would definately book again. Wished we'd stayed for 2 nights !
reviews.title: Brideshead rediscovered

reviews.text: Thank you.
reviews.title: Fab Wedding Venue

reviews.text: Great first impression with long tree lined drive and huge Victorian frontage of the hotel. Helpful staff, nice big room and kingsize bed.Good sized gym and pool with steam and sauna. Spa was fully booked with a hen party so no chance to view/use it. Offer we had was from travelzoo, with one dinner and 2 breakfasts. Breakfasts had lots of choice, eggs a little rubbery, otherwise fine. £25 towards dinner - steak and the sea bass were very tasty. A gratis bottle of wine helped the evening go well. Good location, 2 miles from M6.We went to Chester for the day, only 30 mins away.
reviews.title: spa day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed after friends attending the same wedding had said - ooh, posh, lucky you - when in actual fact we felt like we were at a conference hotel - pack 'em in, don't worry about the experience. The room was perfectly pleasant, but we've have had much better for less money. We hadn't realised we had half a mile to walk to get there and could have been advised to drive round to the side door with our bags etc. Naively we thought a luxury room would be so, not just contemporary. The bar was small, the reception looked dusty and whilst breakfast was pleasant, I'd just hoped for a little better.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to expectations

reviews.text: The approach up to the Hall was impressive it got us really excited!! 6 freinds had come to relax and unwind on the overnight spa break special for a birthday treat.
reviews.title: Brill birthday special Spa break

reviews.text: The reception staff in main hall James? was very good explaining where things were and confirming our lunch and evening meal table was booked. We had booked 3 rooms, 2 standard and 1 Excutive suite which i paid extra for (think it was robes and fridge and toiletries)(being my special birthday! i thought i would treat myself!!) My friends decided to decorate my room with banners and posters (with 21 on of course!!) but were disappointed at the size of the Excutive suite so they change me to one of their standard rooms (above bar) which had lovely windows and very spacious with a settee and chair were we could all gather and drink champage!!!
reviews.title: brilliant 2 day spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the brasserie were very attentive and could not do enough for us!! especially on the evening meal when i had friends coming on a mini bus to meet us so we could go into Nantwich for dancing!! They had our meal out in no time!! thank you! We did get some funny looks at lunch and breakfast when we arrived in our dressing gowns!! which is allowed by the way!!
reviews.title: Beautiful place, excellent food

reviews.text: The Spa : although nice had a bit of a Public swimming pool feel to it!! i think it lacked warmth, my freinds and i have been spa days before and i think that the pool area needs some nice plants and mirrors a bit more intimate feel perhaps some soothing music? and magazines? and a very cold water bottle cooler would be great rather than the fountain! one of the the stone beds did not work and also a few more loungers would be great as a large party of Hens came in and had 2 loungers between them all!!. We were a little confused too when children came into the pool area for lessons ( although these were in the roped off area)
reviews.title: For £99 we thought budget not expecting...

reviews.text: Stayed at hotel with 5 colleagues. 2 of them got food poisoning after eating in the restuarant. Portion sizes for a very expensive meal were not great. With regards to the booking team, not impressed with them. One of my party was unable to travel and someone else stayed instead of them. There was some confusion over the new persons booking. Having spent nearly £2000 on the rooms for the group they have now asked for a further £95 for the room that we had booked for the person who didn't attend although someone else replaced them. With service like that in the current financial climate I would reccomend the DeVere up the road which has a lovely golf course.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, food bad, booking team shocking

reviews.text: Arrived at approx 6pm to book in gave my name etc to receptionist Tamsyn who informed me that they hadnt received confirmation for these holidays we booked a family/quad room & to book in after 3pm. Tamsyn informed us that there was no family rooms left and that we would have to have 2 seperate rooms (i was shocked but was not the hotels fault because of lack of confirmation) Tamsyn was brill she ensured she got 2 rooms close 1 double & 1 twin but the rooms wouldnt be ready for an hour . It is a good job Tasmyn ensured we got some complimentry drinks because after travelling we were ready just to go to our room . I would like to thank TASMYN because if it wasnt for her I would have complained but she was a real role model for the hotel - VERY PLESANT ,POLITE, HELPFUL & COURTEOUS - she even walked us to the room & came back when the cards didnt unlock the doors nothing was too much trouble for her.
reviews.title: chester zoo package

reviews.text: The rooms were comfy and well furnished, breakfast was good so apart from checking in it was an enjoyable stay and would come again. Thanks to TASMYN
reviews.title: What a wonderful Overnight Spa Treat

reviews.text: We have just stayed at Crewe Hall on an overnight Spa treat and what a treat it was :o). The hotel is beautiful, mixing both traditional and modern so there is something for everyone. The food was simply delicious. We ate in the brasserie and the service was fantastic. This is to be said in all areas of service, from reception, to the spa, to the waiters/waitresses. Nothing was too much trouble and all with a smile, we couldn't believe how pleasant and genuine the staff are. We all had 2 x 30 minute spa treatments which we didn't want to end.
reviews.title: Great place a few let downs but overall v good!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for making our stay a really pleasant one, we will be going back for more later in the year :o)
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a deluxe room for 2 nights. Could not find a parking space near the building, so had to run through the rain. Long queue at check-in and only one receptionist on duty. Allocated room 4216 at the far end of the rather ugly glass and steel extension, next to the conference centre. Room poorly lit, standard lamp not working and no replacement buld available until next day. Several of the advertised TV channels not working. Preferred meal from room service menu was "off". Woken throughout the night by vibration and loud low-frequency noise from adjoining machinery plant room. Very disappointed given the price.
reviews.title: Avoid room 4216

reviews.text: Stayed at Crewe with my partner for a friends birthday. We had a room in the new extension, value for money, but if visited again would stay in the hall itself. It's quite a grand place with lots of character, we took some amazing photographs. You can feel the history. The only thing that let the place down was the staff. The health club staff in particular a guy on duty were rude and unhelpful, reception were just okay, not warm or welcoming and we heard staff out the back by the laundry moaning about this and that underneath our room. It is a beautiful place though.
reviews.title: Lots of history!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was quiet and very clean. Room service was prompt.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: My third visit in a year. Went on a spa break for a friend's 50th last year and for another friend this year and inbetween for a treat for a friend and I (the original 50th). The approach is very stylish, down the tree lined drive and then through the gates to a stupendously beautiful stately home. The reception staff remembered me!!! A big surprise with which I was suitably impressed. The rooms in the new wing are big, clean, and more than adequate. I really like the fact that the curtains have a blackout lining so no light seeps through as I cannot sleep in a lit room. The spa facilities are second to none and the ladies employed there are very helpful and friendly. I cannot fault the food in the restaurant for any of the meals. I have never left anything on my plate in any meal I have eaten there and I am a fussy eater.
reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PLACE

reviews.text: A fellow guest we chatted with was staying with his dog in a 'dog friendly room' which I thought was charming. Might bring my old mutt next time.
reviews.title: Return to Crewe Hall

description: A superb 17th century hotel located in Crewe in Cheshire. This Grade I listed building has been attracting refined guests since the 17th century, including our current monarch Queen Elizabeth II. This hotel is a fine mix of historic Jacobean and sharp 21st century architecture. The magnificent history oozes throughout the hotel from exquisite marble fireplaces to stained glass windows. Yet the contemporary edge of Crewe Hall can be found throughout the hotel from the revolving bar in the brasserie to the state-of-the-art leisure club. The hotel has 117 spacious, comfortable bedrooms, some are located in the historic old building but majority can be found in the new contemporary wing. Just minutes from the M6 motorway, Crewe Hall is only 24 miles from Chester’s sights and shops and close to Liverpool and Manchester.Crewe Hall is home to a modern conference and events centre. It is very impressive with both it's facilities and service that we offer you. Modern facilities, free Wi-Fi, extensive grounds and a meetings package that gives you total piece of mind, whether you’re brainstorming with the team or delivering an important message, Crewe Hall makes meetings easy.
